pages.text: Most instruments in MIMI are hand-held instruments which can be played while being held in your hand.$(br2)By using a Linked FileCaster or System MIDI Input Device it is possible to play two hand-held instruments at the same time in your main and off hands.

pages.title: Opening the GUI
pages.text: A hand-held instrument can be played by right-clicking while holding the instrument in your main hand. This will open up the $(l:instruments_gui)Instrument GUI$(/l).$(br2)While the GUI is open you will be unable to walk around as your keyboard input will be used by the GUI to play notes.

pages.title: Opening the GUI
pages.text: The instrument GUI can also be opened for hand-held instruments by pressing configured keybinds for each hand. Opening the GUI this way allows you to play two instruments at the same time and easily access the GUI for each one.$(br2)Main Hand Keybind: $(l)$(k:key.mimi.midi.gui.main)$()$(br2)Off Hand Keybind: $(l)$(k:key.mimi.midi.gui.off)$()

pages.title: Playing without GUI
pages.text: Hand-held instruments can also be played without the GUI by setting a Linked FileCaster or System MIDI Input Device on the instrument and then holding it in either your main hand or off hand.$(br2)Playing hand-held instruments without the GUI open will allow you to move while playing.
